text: Assigning IAM policies at the group level also makes B % it easier to adjust permissions when an employee & transfers to a different job. For example, if a cashier becomes an inventory specialist, the coffee shop “Cashiers” IAM group owner removes them from the “Cashiers” IAM group and adds them into the “Inventory Specialists” IAM group. This ensures that employees have only the permissions that are required for their current role. & & & What if a coffee shop employee hasn't switched jobs permanently, but instead, rotates to different Cashier 1 Cashier 2 Cashier 3 workstations throughout the day? This employee can get the access they need through 1AM roles.
